intro: Avenastrum mannii var. angustius, commonly known as the narrowleaf avenastrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is perennial and has a fibrous root system, which helps it survive in arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native region.
